intro: Decaisnina longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed decaisnina, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Decaisnina longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
